subject: Negotiation
title: Positions vs. Interests
description: A quick, practical guide to Positions vs. Interests.

hook.text: Two siblings fought over the last orange until their mother asked why each wanted it.

buildup.text: One wanted the juice. The other wanted the peel for baking. Both could have everything.

discovery.text: Positions are what people say they want. Interests are why they want it.

twist.text: Most deals stall because both sides argue positions instead of exploring interests.

climax.text: Ask 'why?' five times and you'll find a creative deal hiding underneath.

punchline.text: Behind every demand is a need. Find the need.

quiz.question: What is the difference between positions and interests?
options: Positions are what people want; interests are why
Positions are flexible; interests are rigid
